Recipe.Description: Tomatoes. What are they? Nobody knows. Are they a fruit? Yes, botanically. Are they a vegetable? Yes, commercially. Are they poisonous? The fruit, no. The plant, slightly. Are they good to eat? When they are in season and fresh, they can be exquisite. Out of season, strip-mined in Texas and processed through some DuPont facility, they are insipid. What can you do with them? What can't you do with them? You can peel them, as follows...

Method.Step: Put tomatoes in boiling water for 20 - 30 seconds.
Remove tomatoes from pot and into chilled water.
Slip skins from tomatoes, remove core.
Use or refrigerate the tomatoes. Use the skins to make Tomato Confetti or Tomato Powder
